DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-COMPLETO: Alice Reis de Barros e Azevedo

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Alice Reis oceangrafa, formada pela Universidade Federal da Bahia e mestre em Ecologia e Biomonitoramento pela mesma instituio.Atualmente, aluna doutoranda no programa de ps-graduao em Ecologia:Teoria, Prtica e Valores na UFBA (2019-atual) e estuda interaes entre marismas e manguezais. No mestrado (2017-2019) avaliou o papel de marismas tropicais como refgio para caranguejos ocipoddeos. Durante a graduao (2010-2016) participou do Programa Cincias Sem Fronteiras na Universit di Pisa, Itlia, onde cursou Laurea Magistrale em Biologia Marina durante 12 meses (2013-2014). Anteriormente, foi bolsista PIBIC no perodo de 2012-2013, no Laboratrio de Ecologia Bentnica(LEB) da Universidade Federal da Bahia, onde participa de atividades de pesquisa relacionadas a organismos bentnicos em ambientes estuarinos at o presente momento.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Alice Reis is an oceanographer, graduated from the Federal University of Bahia and has a master's degree in Ecology and Biomonitoring by the same institution. Currently, she is a doctoral student in the postgraduate program in Ecology: Theory, Practice and Values ​​at UFBA and studies interactions between saltmarshes and mangroves. In the master she evaluated the role of tropical saltmarshes as a refuge for fiddler crabs. During graduation she participated in the Science Without Borders Program at Universit di Pisa, Italy, coursing Laurea Magistrale in Biology Marina for 12 months (2013-2014). Previously, she received a PIBIC scholarship in the period 2012-2013, at the Benthic Ecology Laboratory (LEB) of the Federal University of Bahia, where she participates in research activities related to benthic organisms in estuarine environments to date.
